title: Remove 20 per cent export duty on onions: Ajit Pawar to Centre
desc: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister, has written to the Union Commerce Minister. Pawar seeks removal of the 20% export duty on onions. Nashik onion farmers face distress due to low prices. The current rate is around Rs 2,400 per quintal. Unseasonal rains and climate change have impacted earnings. The export duty makes Maharashtra onions less competitive globally.

title: Govt will not remove temples built on Waqf properties, CM Siddaramaiah tells Assembly
desc: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah promised no temple demolition on Waqf land. Eviction notices will be withdrawn. BJP raised the Waqf issue in the Assembly. Minister Zameer Ahmed Khan confirmed notice withdrawals for farmers and temples. BJP demanded removal of Waqf property mentions from records. Siddaramaiah highlighted the reduction of Waqf properties. BJP staged a walkout, unsatisfied with the government's response.

title: Sharad Pawar meets PM Modi along with two farmers from Maharashtra
desc: NCP-SP chief Sharad Pawar met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Parliament, presenting him with pomegranates from Maharashtra farmers. Weeks prior, the BJP-led alliance decisively defeated Pawar's MVA in the state assembly elections. Although Pawar recently invited Modi to inaugurate a literary event, the topic wasn't discussed during their meeting.

title: If talks happen, they will be with central government: Sarwan Singh Pandher after farmers reject SC committee
desc: Farmers protesting at the Khanauri border rejected a Supreme Court-appointed committee, insisting on talks with the central government. Sarwan Singh Pandher, representing the protesting farmers, stated the committee failed to address issues promptly. Simultaneously, Jagjit Singh Dallewal, on hunger strike for 22 days, criticized the committee's delayed response and confirmed future discussions would be held solely with the central government.

title: Getting ready for bigger protests, will announce today or tomorrow: Sarwan Singh Pandher
desc: Farmers in Punjab, led by the Kisan Mazdoor Sangharsh Committee, planned a 'Rail Roko Andolan,' halting trains to protest agricultural losses and lack of Minimum Support Price (MSP). They threatened larger protests and barred BJP officials from rural areas. Simultaneously, farmers refused to meet the Supreme Court-appointed committee, demanding direct talks with the central government.

title: Implement legally binding MSP, waive farm loans: House panel
desc: A parliamentary panel recommended implementing a legally binding minimum support price (MSP) for farm produce, along with loan waivers for farmers and laborers. This recommendation aligns with the demands of protesting farmers, particularly from Punjab, who are seeking financial stability and a reduction in farmer suicides.

title: Cong promoted water disputes between states, does little for farmers: PM Modi
desc: Prime Minister Modi criticized Congress for delaying the Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project, accusing them of hindering farmers' progress. He highlighted the BJP's collaborative approach to water management, contrasting it with Congress's promotion of interstate water disputes. Modi also praised the Rajasthan BJP government's achievements in its first year.

title: Farmers to stage 'Rail Roko' in Punjab at 12 noon tomorrow
desc: Farmers in Punjab planned a three-hour rail blockade. Their leader Sarwan Singh Pandher urged public participation. He voiced concern for Jagjit Singh Dallewal's health. Dallewal was on a hunger strike. A Congress MP raised the issue in Parliament. He demanded government action to address farmers' concerns.

title: Emergency-like situation: Vinesh Phogat calls for nationwide participation in farmers' protest
desc: Vinesh Phogat joined farmers protesting at the Khanauri border. Farmers and leaders are demanding minimum support prices for crops. DGP Gaurav Yadav met with farmer leaders. He urged medical assistance for Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who is on a hunger strike. The Supreme Court asked for Dallewal's well-being. The protest continues with farmers demanding action.

title: Farmer leader announces 'Tractor March' and 'Rail Roko' on Dec 16, 18 in Punjab
desc: Farmers in Punjab, led by Sarwan Singh Pandher, plan a tractor march on December 16th outside Punjab and a 'Rail Roko' protest on December 18th. This follows a clash with police at the Shambhu border, where tear gas and water cannons were used, allegedly injuring 17 farmers. Pandher criticized the opposition's lack of support for farmers' issues in Parliament.

title: Farmers suspend foot march to Delhi for the day
desc: Farmers protesting near the Punjab-Haryana border suspended their march to Delhi after Haryana police used tear gas and water cannons, injuring several. Farmers allege rubber bullets and chemical-laced water were also used. They are demanding guaranteed minimum support prices for crops, debt relief, and other concessions, and question which constitution protects their right to protest.

title: Punjab: Tear gas, water cannon used against protesting farmers at Shambhu border
desc: Haryana police used tear gas and water cannons to stop farmers marching towards Delhi on Saturday. Farmers were injured and treated. Authorities attempted to negotiate, but farmers insisted on proceeding without Delhi's permission. This is the third such attempt, with previous marches on December 6th and 8th also blocked.

title: Punjab: 'Jatha' of 101 farmers to resume foot march towards Delhi
desc: 101 farmers resumed their march to Delhi from the Shambhu border on Saturday, demanding a legal guarantee for MSP. Haryana suspended internet and SMS services in 12 Ambala villages. This marks the farmers' third attempt to reach the capital since December 6, facing barricades and restrictions. Meanwhile, farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's fast unto death entered its 19th day.

title: Our group will move to Delhi at noon, says farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher
desc: A group of farmers will begin a peaceful march toward Delhi to protest, farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher said, urging the government to engage in talks. Ambala authorities clarified the farmers lacked permission for the Delhi protest.

title: Karnataka HC quashes FIR against BJP MP Tejasvi Surya over farmer suicide post
desc: The Karnataka High Court quashed an FIR against BJP MP Tejasvi Surya concerning a social media post linking a farmer's suicide to Waqf Board land claims.

title: Telangana: "A year of betrayal, misgovernance," KTR slams Congress govt
desc: BRS working president K.T. Rama Rao criticized the Congress-led Telangana government on its first anniversary, citing unfulfilled promises and misgovernance. He highlighted issues like farmer suicides, neglected women's welfare, and corruption in projects like the Musi beautification initiative. KTR urged the government to prioritize citizen welfare over politics.

title: Opposition protests disrupt Lok Sabha proceedings; House adjourns for day
desc: Lok Sabha proceedings were repeatedly adjourned on Monday due to opposition protests. Members raised concerns about alleged links between George Soros and the Congress party, as well as the Adani issue. The Speaker's attempts to restore order failed, leading to adjournments throughout the day. Previous disruptions had also hampered parliamentary proceedings.

title: Farmers pleading for justice because Modi govt 'betrayed' them again and again: Kharge
desc: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for allegedly betraying farmers. Kharge highlighted unfulfilled promises on income, MSP, and fertilizer shortages. He condemned the government's forceful response to farmers' protests, including tear gas and barricades at the Delhi border. Kharge urged the government to address farmers' concerns and respect their right to protest.

title: Farmers unhappy with both INDIA bloc and BJP, says Farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher
desc: Farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher criticized PM Modi's visit to Haryana on Monday, questioning whether the PM would claim his party's election victories as evidence of the success of his development approach. Pandher emphasized that farmers remain dissatisfied with both the ruling BJP and the opposition INDIA alliance, urging Modi to address their concerns and take action on the ongoing farmers' protest.

title: Congress slams government for tear-gassing farmers
desc: Congress criticized the central and Haryana governments for using tear gas on protesting farmers at the Shambhu border. Farmers were marching to Delhi to demand guaranteed minimum support prices (MSP), a promise Congress alleges the BJP government broke after over 700 farmer deaths during previous protests. Congress accused the BJP of favoring capitalists while denying fair prices to farmers and escalating farming costs.

title: Third Eye: Hunger strike by farmers, hoax bomb threats, and slowdown in Kota industry
desc: Farmers in Greater Noida jail launched a hunger strike for land rights. A hoax bomb threat targeted Lucknow's major transit hubs. Kota's coaching industry faces a downturn due to student suicides, new regulations, and market expansion, impacting student numbers and revenue.

title: Modi govt in no mood for talks, 101 farmers to march towards Delhi on Sunday: Pandher
desc: Farmers protesting at the Punjab-Haryana border plan to resume their march to Delhi on December 8 after being stopped by tear gas on Friday. They demand talks with the Centre on issues including MSP and debt waiver, alleging the government is unwilling to negotiate. One farmer leader continues a hunger strike, while others claim injuries from the police response.

title: 'Farmers' demands are related to Centre, not state': Punjab Minister on 'Dilli Chalo' protest march
desc: Punjab Minister Baljit Kaur criticized the Union Government for the ongoing farmers' 'Dilli Chalo' protest, stating that the farmers' demands are directed at the Centre, not the state. Farmers in Punjab are protesting at Sambhu border, demanding compensation and a legal guarantee for Minimum Support Price (MSP).

title: Surveying mosques is wrong while people and farmers suffering: Robert Vadra
desc: Robert Vadra criticized the political focus on mosque surveys amidst inflation and farmer protests. He stressed the importance of separating religion and politics, advocating for peace and harmony. Vadra also questioned EVM credibility and raised concerns about the Adani issue, while expressing confidence in Priyanka Gandhi's future role in politics.

title: Farmers' protests received huge booster dose from no less than Vice President: Congress
desc: Farmers marched towards Delhi, demanding legal guarantee for MSP and other key issues. Congress backed the protests, highlighting Vice President Dhankhar's recent remarks questioning the government's fulfillment of promises made to farmers. Heavy security presence met the farmers at the Haryana border.

title: BJP alleges Rahul Gandhi colluding with 'anti-India forces'
desc: The BJP has accused Rahul Gandhi of collaborating with "anti-India international forces," citing a Mediapart report on OCCRP's funding and Gandhi's meetings with alleged Modi government critics. The party highlighted the timing of reports critical of India coinciding with parliamentary sessions, including those on farmers, Pegasus, Hindenburg, and the BBC documentary.

title: Congress rakes up Jagdeep Dhankhar’s remarks to raise farmers’ protest issue in Rajya Sabha
desc: Opposition members in the Rajya Sabha protested against the government's handling of farmer demands, citing Chairman Dhankhar's recent remarks on the issue. They shouted slogans, staged a walkout, and demanded action on Minimum Support Price (MSP) guarantees. Dhankhar criticized the Opposition's timing, claiming their concern was disingenuous. The House eventually resumed normal function.

title: Opposition shuns disruption; debates
desc: Rajya Sabha resumed normal functioning as the Opposition dropped plans to disrupt proceedings. Key issues such as law and order in various states, the Adani bribery issue, and displacement due to natural calamities were debated. A bill was passed and multiple pressing topics were discussed during the zero hour and question hour.

title: 'My doors are open for farmers 24/7': VP Dhankhar urges protesting farmers to resolve issues through dialogue
desc: Terming an irretrievable and confrontational stance as poor diplomacy, he emphasized, "We need to think openly and engage in open discussions because this country belongs to us. It is deeply influenced by its rural roots, and I believe that wherever my farmer brothers are and whichever protest they may be part of, my words will reach them, and they will pay attention. I am confident that a convergence of positive energy will lead to the swiftest resolution of farmers' issues."
